page.title: 07RELIGION-St. Peter's Church.
page.content:
Within this survey area the only place of worship is the Anglican church of{St. Peter's}in Duddon.
This church was built in 1835 and celebrates one hundred and fifty years of worship in October, 1985. St. Peter's is a "Chapel of Ease", originally established to make worship more accessible to those living some distance from the parish church of St. Andrew's, Tarvin.
The building is of red brick with a tiled roof. The East window is a stained glass one depicting Jesus, The Good Shepherd. The carved altar screen is dedicated to local people who were killed in the First World War. There is also a notice board memorial to those killed during the Second World war.
